availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Holt (Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney. Bath County, Kentucky, native. Son of Gideon Joseph Holt and Fanny Tyler Holt. Married to Sarah Roberts Holt on October 19, 1864.Graduated from Albany University in Albany County, New York, in 1862. Admitted to the New York bar in 1862. Attorney in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in June 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mt. Sterling, p. 307A.
"Judge Holt Will Accept," The Daily Leader (Lexington, KY), June 5, 1900, p. 3.
E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry and Modern Activities, (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), pp. 1048-1049.
"William Henry Holt (1842-1919)," Find A Grave, Memorial 143073707, accessed September 30, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/143073707.
